ARABIC: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We have never destroyed a city without giving it prior warning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Never have We destroyed a habitation till We had sent admonishers to them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We never destroyed any habitation but that it had warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We never destroyed any town without first sending to them warning and guidance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And never did We destroy a township which did not have Heralds of warning, –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And never did We destroy a township but it had its warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We did not destroy any town but it had (its) warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Never a city We destroyed, but it had warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And We destroyed no township but it had its warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Never have We destroyed a town without sending down messengers to warn it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We destroyed not a city but it had its warners.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We have not destroyed any town without its having warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Never did We destroy a population, but had its warners -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And never did We destroy a township, but it had its warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We never destroyed a village that did not have warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Never did We destroy a town, but it had warners.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:208] And We have not destroyed any town but it had warners, messengers to warn its inhabitants;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And We destroyed no township) no inhabitants of any township (but it had its warners) warning messengers,
